Package net.minecraftforge.client.event

Class RenderPlayerEvent

java.lang.Object
net.minecraftforge.eventbus.api.Event
net.minecraftforge.event.entity.EntityEvent
net.minecraftforge.event.entity.living.LivingEvent
net.minecraftforge.event.entity.player.PlayerEvent
net.minecraftforge.client.event.RenderPlayerEvent
Direct Known Subclasses:
RenderPlayerEvent.Post, RenderPlayerEvent.Pre
public abstract class RenderPlayerEvent
extends net.minecraftforge.event.entity.player.PlayerEvent

Fired when a player is being rendered. See the two subclasses for listening for before and after rendering.

See Also:
PlayerRenderer

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  RenderPlayerEvent.Post
    Fired after the player is rendered, if the corresponding RenderPlayerEvent.Pre is not cancelled.
    static class  RenderPlayerEvent.Pre
    Fired before the player is rendered.

    • RenderPlayerEvent

      public RenderPlayerEvent​(net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player, net.minecraft.client.renderer.entity.PlayerRenderer renderer, float partialRenderTick, com.mojang.blaze3d.matrix.MatrixStack stack, net.minecraft.client.renderer.IRenderTypeBuffer buffers, int light)

  • Method Details

    • getRenderer

      public net.minecraft.client.renderer.entity.PlayerRenderer getRenderer()

      Returns the PlayerRenderer for the player entity.

      Returns:
      The renderer for the player entity

    • getPartialRenderTick

      public float getPartialRenderTick()

      Returns the partial amount of ticks between the last and next render tick. This will be in the range of 0.0F to 1.0F.

      Returns:
      The amount of partial ticks

    • getMatrixStack

      public com.mojang.blaze3d.matrix.MatrixStack getMatrixStack()

      Returns the MatrixStack used for transformations, rotations, and scaling in rendering.

      Returns:
      The matrix stack used for rendering

    • getBuffers

      public net.minecraft.client.renderer.IRenderTypeBuffer getBuffers()

      Returns the IRenderTypeBuffer currently being used for rendering.

      Returns:
      The rendering buffers

    • getLight

      public int getLight()

      Returns an integer packed with the sky and block light. This is used in rendering to determine the color of the light level of the block, according to the light texture.

      Returns:
      The amount of packed light for rendering
      See Also:
      LightTexture.getLightSky(int)
